Name: TC-001: Successful Login with Valid Credentials
Objective: Verify user can login with valid Spectrum credentials
Pre-condition: User account exists in Spectrum system
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Brand Manager login page
Step 2: Enter valid username and password

Test Result: User authenticated and redirected to dashboard

Name: TC-002: Login Failure with Invalid Credentials
Objective: Verify system rejects invalid login credentials
Pre-condition: User account exists in Spectrum system
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Brand Manager login page
Step 2: Enter invalid username or password

Test Result: Error message displayed: "Invalid credentials", user remains on login page

Name: TC-003: Login with Missing Credentials
Objective: Verify validation for required login fields

Test Step: Step 3: Enter username and leave password empty

Name: TC-004: Session Expiration After Timeout
Objective: Verify user session expires after inactivity period

Test Step: Step 3: Attempt to perform any action
Test Result: User logged out automatically, redirected to login page with message: "Session expired"

Name: TC-005: Access with Valid Feature ID
Objective: Verify user with valid Feature ID can access authorized features
Pre-condition: User authenticated with Feature ID assigned
Test Step: Step 1: Login with user having valid Feature ID
Step 2: Navigate to Brand Manager dashboard
Step 3: Verify authorized features are visible

Name: TC-006: Access Denied Without Feature ID
Objective: Verify user without Feature ID cannot access the system
Test Step: Step 1: Login with user without Feature ID
Test Result: Login may succeed but access restricted

Test Step: Step 2: Attempt to access Brand Manager features
Test Result: Error message: "Access denied. Feature ID required"

Name: TC-007: Role-Based Feature Access - Admin
Objective: Verify admin role has full access to all features

Test Step: Step 2: Verify access to all features (Brand Stats Store Stats Orders Cancellations)
Step 3: Verify ability to perform all actions
Test Result: All actions can be performed successfully

Name: TC-008: Privilege Escalation Prevention
Objective: Verify system prevents unauthorized privilege escalation

Test Step: Step 2: Attempt to access admin-only feature (e.g., User Migration)
Test Data: Direct URL manipulation or API call

Test Result: Security event logged in audit trail

Name: TC-009: Omni Auth Library Token Validation - Valid Token
Objective: Verify Omni Auth Library validates legitimate access tokens
Pre-condition: User logged in with valid token
Test Step: Step 1: Make API request with valid auth token
Step 2: Verify API request is authorized

Name: TC-010: Omni Auth Library Rejects Invalid Token
Objective: Verify Omni Auth Library rejects tampered or invalid tokens
Test Step: Step 1: Make API request with invalid token

Name: TC-011: Omni Auth Library Rejects Expired Token
Objective: Verify Omni Auth Library detects and rejects expired tokens
Test Step: Step 1: Make API request with expired token

Test Result: Response: 401 Unauthorized, Error: "Token expired. Please re-login"

Name: TC-012: Manual User Creation from CRMBase
Objective: Verify admin can manually create users from CRMBase data

Test Step: Step 2: Navigate to User Migration section
Step 3: Extract user data from CRMBase
Step 4: Create user in Spectrum system
Test Data: Username: user123, Email: user123@test.com, Role: Brand Manager

Test Step: Step 5: Verify user can login with new credentials

Name: TC-013: Manual Role Assignment During Migration
Objective: Verify roles can be assigned during manual user migration
Test Step: Step 1: Create new user during migration
Step 3: Save user with assigned role
Test Result: User created with role: Store Manager

Test Step: Step 4: Verify user has correct role permissions

Name: TC-014: Credential Mismatch Warning in Manual Migration
Objective: Verify system warns about credential mismatches during manual migration
Test Step: Step 1: Extract user data from CRMBase
Step 2: Attempt to create user with mismatched credentials
Test Result: Warning displayed: "Username already exists with different credentials"

Test Step: Step 3: Choose to update or skip
Test Result: Admin can update or skip the user

Name: TC-015: EDA Pipeline Automated User Migration - Success
Objective: Verify EDA pipeline successfully migrates users from Informix to Spectrum
Pre-condition: EDA pipeline configured Informix database accessible

Test Result: Migration completed successfully, summary report generated

Test Step: Step 5: Validate migrated users can login

Name: TC-016: EDA Pipeline Large User Set Migration
Objective: Verify EDA pipeline handles migration of large user datasets

Test Step: Step 2: Monitor system performance during migration

Test Result: All 1000+ users migrated successfully, no data loss

Test Step: Step 4: Validate sample of migrated users
Test Result: All sampled users can login with correct roles

Name: TC-017: EDA Pipeline Migration Failure Recovery
Objective: Verify EDA pipeline handles failures and supports rollback or retry

Test Step: Step 2: Simulate network failure during migration

Test Result: System rolls back partial migration or marks for retry, data integrity maintained
Migration resumes from last successful point

Test Step: Step 5: Verify successful completion after retry
Test Result: All users migrated successfully, no duplicates

Name: TC-018: Display Brand-Level Aggregate Statistics
Objective: Verify brand-level aggregate statistics are displayed correctly
Pre-condition: User authorized Brand exists in system

Test Step: Step 2: Navigate to Brand Level Stats page

Test Data: Stats: Total Orders, Revenue, Active Stores
Test Result: Stats displayed accurately from OrderHub API

Name: TC-019: Refresh Brand Stats On Demand
Objective: Verify brand statistics can be refreshed on demand
Test Step: Step 1: Display brand stats for Brand A
Step 3: Update order in backend (simulate new order)
Step 4: Click Refresh button on UI

Name: TC-020: Filter Brand Stats by Date Range
Objective: Verify brand stats can be filtered by date range
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Brand Stats page
Step 4: Verify stats shown only for selected date range

Name: TC-021: Brand Stats API Failure Handling
Objective: Verify UI handles brand stats API failures gracefully
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Brand Stats page
Step 2: Simulate OrderHub API timeout or error
Test Result: Error message displayed: "Unable to load brand stats. Please try again."

Test Step: Step 4: Click retry and verify recovery

Name: TC-022: Display Store-Level Statistics
Objective: Verify store-level statistics are displayed correctly

Test Step: Step 2: Navigate to Store Level Stats page

Name: TC-023: Combine Stores API and NOS Data for Store Stats
Objective: Verify store stats combine data from Stores API and NOS Bulk Order API
Pre-condition: Stores API and NOS API available
Test Step: Step 1: Request store stats for Store 101
Step 2: Verify data fetched from Stores API
Step 3: Verify data fetched from NOS Bulk Order API
Test Result: Bulk orders: Count, Total value retrieved

Test Step: Step 4: Verify combined data displayed on UI
Test Result: Combined stats: Store info + Bulk order data shown

Name: TC-024: Handle Pagination for Store Stats (Future Enhancement)
Objective: Verify pagination works for store stats when large datasets exist
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Store Stats page

Test Result: Pagination controls shown (Next Previous Page numbers)

Test Step: Step 3: Click Next to navigate to page 2
Step 4: Verify page 2 data is different from page 1
Test Result: Page 2 shows next set of records

Test Step: Step 5: Click Previous to return to page 1

Name: TC-025: Store Stats API Integration Failure
Objective: Verify UI handles partial or complete API failures for store stats
Pre-condition: Stores API available NOS API fails

Test Step: Step 2: Stores API returns success NOS API fails
Test Result: Partial data displayed with message: "Some data unavailable. NOS API error."

Test Step: Step 3: Verify retry option for failed API
Test Result: Retry button for NOS data available

Test Result: Summary info shown for each order

Name: TC-027: Paginate Through Orders List
Objective: Verify user can navigate through order pages

Objective: Verify orders can be filtered by order status

Test Result: Only orders with status Shipped are shown

Name: TC-029: Orders API Failure Handling
Objective: Verify UI handles OrderHub API failures when loading orders

Name: TC-030: Display Order Details
Objective: Verify detailed order information is displayed when order is selected

Objective: Verify validation for malformed Customer ID

Name: TC-042: Bulk Cancel Eligible Orders Successfully
Objective: Verify multiple eligible orders can be cancelled in bulk
Pre-condition: User authorized Multiple eligible orders exist

Test Step: Step 2: Select multiple orders eligible for cancellation

Test Result: Cancellation request sent to OMS Bulk Cancel API
Success message: "3 orders cancelled successfully", order statuses updated to Cancelled

Name: TC-043: Bulk Cancel with Mixed Eligibility
Objective: Verify system handles bulk cancellation when some orders are not eligible

Test Step: Step 2: Select mix of eligible and ineligible orders
Test Data: Eligible: ORD-001, ORD-002; Ineligible: ORD-003 (already shipped)

Test Step: Step 4: Review warning about ineligible orders
Step 5: Confirm to proceed with eligible orders only

Test Result: ORD-001 and ORD-002 cancelled, ORD-003 status unchanged, summary report shown

Name: TC-044: Bulk Cancel API Failure
Objective: Verify error handling when OMS Bulk Cancel API fails

Step 2: Click Bulk Cancel and confirm

Test Result: Error message: "Bulk cancellation failed. Please try again."

Test Step: Step 4: Verify orders remain in original status

Name: TC-045: Bulk Cancel Confirmation Dialog

Validation error: "Refund amount must be greater than zero"

Objective: Verify error handling when SHREWS API fails during refund processing

Order status unchanged no refund recorded

Objective: Verify validation for required SR fields

Objective: Verify validation for invalid SR type values

Name: TC-054: Store Expedite Report in CosmosDB
Objective: Verify expedite reports are stored successfully in CosmosDB

Test Result: Success message: "Report saved successfully", Report ID generated

Objective: Verify expedite reports can be retrieved from CosmosDB

Step 2: Enter Report ID or select from list

Test Result: Report displayed with all details: Cancelled orders, dates, reasons

Name: TC-056: CosmosDB Connection Failure During Report Operation
Objective: Verify error handling when CosmosDB is unavailable
Test Step: Step 1: Attempt to save or retrieve report

Test Result: Error message: "Database connection failed. Unable to process report."
Retry button available or automatic retry after 30 seconds

Name: TC-057: Generate CSV Report from Data Successfully
Objective: Verify CSV report can be generated and downloaded from displayed data
Pre-condition: Data displayed on screen User authorized
Test Step: Step 1: Navigate to Orders screen with data displayed
Step 2: Click Export to CSV button
Step 3: Verify CSV file generated dynamically by Frontend
Test Result: CSV file downloaded, file name: Orders_Export_2026-02-03.csv

Test Step: Step 4: Open CSV file and verify data
Test Result: CSV contains correct columns: Order ID, Customer, Status, Date, Total

Test Step: Step 5: Verify data matches UI display
Test Result: Data in CSV matches data displayed on screen

Name: TC-058: Generate CSV with Filtered Data Only
Objective: Verify CSV export includes only filtered/visible data
Test Step: Step 1: Apply filter to Orders screen
Step 2: Note count of filtered records
Step 3: Click Export to CSV button
Step 4: Open CSV file and verify row count
Step 5: Verify all rows have Status = Shipped
Test Result: All exported orders have Shipped status

Name: TC-059: CSV Export with Special Characters
Objective: Verify special characters in data are properly escaped in CSV
Test Step: Step 1: Display data with special characters
Step 3: Open CSV in text editor
Step 4: Verify special characters properly escaped
Test Result: Quotes escaped with double quotes or backslashes, commas within quoted fields

Test Step: Step 5: Open CSV in Excel and verify data renders correctly

Name: TC-060: CSV Export Exceeds Maximum Row Limit
Objective: Verify system handles export when data exceeds maximum allowed rows
Test Step: Step 1: Display data set with 10000+ rows
Step 2: Click Export to CSV button

Test Result: Either: (A) Warning: "Export limited to 10000 rows" and export proceeds, OR (B) Error: "Export too large. Please apply filters"

Test Step: Step 4: If export proceeds verify row count in CSV

Name: TC-061: Brand Manager Web UI Loads Successfully
Objective: Verify Brand Manager Web UI loads without errors

Test Result: Dashboard displayed, no console errors, all components visible
All menu items clickable and navigate to correct pages

Name: TC-062: UI Handles Responsive Layout (Future Enhancement)
Objective: Verify UI adapts to different screen sizes
Test Step: Step 1: Load Brand Manager UI in desktop browser
Step 2: Resize browser window to tablet size
Step 4: Verify all functionality accessible at each size
Test Result: Menus, buttons, forms usable at all sizes

Name: TC-063: UI Error Boundary Catches Runtime Errors
Objective: Verify UI error boundary prevents complete app crash on runtime errors

Test Step: Step 2: Trigger a runtime error (e.g. null reference)
Step 3: Verify error boundary catches error
Test Result: Error boundary displays: "Something went wrong" with error details or generic message

Test Step: Step 4: Verify rest of app remains functional

Name: TC-064: BFF Orchestrates Multiple API Calls Successfully
Objective: Verify BFF aggregates data from multiple backend APIs correctly
Test Step: Step 1: Make request to BFF endpoint
Step 2: Verify BFF calls Stores API and NOS API
Test Result: BFF makes parallel calls to Stores API and NOS API
BFF combines data: Store info + Bulk order data

Test Step: Step 4: Verify aggregated response returned to client
Test Result: Response contains combined data in single JSON object

Name: TC-065: BFF Handles Partial API Failures Gracefully
Objective: Verify BFF provides partial data when one API fails
Pre-condition: Stores API available NOS API fails

Test Step: Step 2: Stores API succeeds NOS API fails
Test Result: Stores API returns data, NOS API times out

Test Step: Step 3: Verify BFF returns partial data with error info
Test Result: Response includes Stores data with flag: "nosDataUnavailable: true"

Test Step: Step 4: Verify UI handles partial data
Test Result: UI displays available data with warning about missing info

Name: TC-066: BFF Validates Request Data
Objective: Verify BFF validates incoming request data before calling backend APIs
Test Step: Step 1: Send request with invalid data to BFF

Test Result: BFF returns 400 Bad Request with error: "Order ID is required"

Test Step: Step 3: Verify backend APIs not called with invalid data
Test Result: Backend APIs not invoked (BFF validation prevents unnecessary calls)

Name: TC-067: BFF Caching Mechanism Improves Performance
Objective: Verify BFF caches responses to improve performance
Test Step: Step 1: Make first request to BFF
Step 3: Make identical request within cache TTL

Name: TC-068: Successful OrderHub API Call Returns Data
Objective: Verify OrderHub API responds successfully to valid requests
Test Step: Step 1: Make API call to OrderHub
Step 3: Verify response contains valid order data
Test Result: JSON response with orders array, each order has required fields: orderId, customerId, status, total

Name: TC-069: OrderHub API Timeout Handling
Objective: Verify system handles OrderHub API timeouts gracefully
Test Step: Step 1: Make API call to OrderHub

Test Result: BFF returns error to UI: "OrderHub timeout. Please try again."
Automatic retry after 5 seconds or manual retry option

Name: TC-070: OrderHub API Returns Error Response
Objective: Verify system handles OrderHub API errors appropriately
Test Step: Step 1: Make API call to OrderHub
Step 2: OrderHub returns 500 Internal Server Error
Test Result: Response: 500 error with message: "Internal server error"
BFF logs error and returns user-friendly message: "Unable to retrieve order details"

Test Step: Step 4: Verify UI displays error message
Test Result: Error displayed to user with retry option

Name: TC-071: OrderHub API Malformed Response Handling
Objective: Verify system detects and handles malformed API responses
Test Step: Step 1: Make API call to OrderHub
Step 3: Verify BFF detects malformed response
Test Result: BFF JSON parsing fails, error caught
Error message: "Invalid data received from OrderHub. Please try again."

Name: TC-072: NOS Bulk Order API Success Response
Objective: Verify NOS Bulk Order API returns bulk order data successfully
Test Step: Step 1: Make API call to NOS Bulk Order API
Step 3: Verify response contains bulk order data
Test Result: JSON response with bulk orders: orderId, quantity, totalAmount, storeId

Test Step: Step 4: Verify UI shows appropriate message

Step 3: Verify response contains store data
